definitions.definition: to see or become conscious of something or someone:
examples: I noticed a crack in the ceiling.

definitions.definition: to bring someone to the attention of the public, usually because of an unusual skill, etc.:
examples: She was first noticed by the critics at the age of twelve, and went on to become a world-famous violinist.

definitions.definition: (a board, piece of paper, etc. containing) information or instructions:
examples: There was a large notice on the wall saying "No Parking".

definitions.definition: printed statements of opinion in the newspapers about plays, films, books, etc.:
examples: The musical has received wonderful notices.
